intro: Savia andringitrana var. micrantha, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. It has a compact growth habit with a basal rosette of leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
